case_title: Said-ur-Rehman and another vs The State and another
bench: Mr. Justice Malik Shahzad Ahmad Khan
procedural_history: The case was an appeal against the judgment dated 09.06.2021 of the Peshawar High Court, Mingora Bench, which upheld the convictions and sentences of the appellants. The appellants were convicted for the murder of two young men and sentenced to death.
key_facts: The appellants were accused of the brutal murders of Shah Faisal and Shafi-ur-Rehman. The case involved issues of illegal arrest, lack of evidence, and the integrity of the investigation process. The trial court convicted the appellants based on judicial confessions and recovery of incriminating evidence.
issues: Legality of the inquiry ordered by the Magistrate under section 156(3) of the Cr.P.C.
Validity of the judicial confessions recorded under section 164 of the Cr.P.C.
Integrity of the investigation and prosecution process.

holding.short_order: The petition was converted into an appeal and allowed, resulting in the acquittal of the appellants.
quoted_lines: The judgments of the trial court and the High Court dated 08.01.2020 and 09.06.2021 respectively were set-aside.
The commission of the crime in this case resulted in the gruesome and brutal murders of two young men.

takeaways: The case highlights the deficiencies in the criminal justice system, particularly in investigation and prosecution.
Judicial confessions must be scrutinized for legality, especially when the arrest was made without proper registration of an FIR.
